title: How to Make Clothing Stain Remover with Peroxide

steps.headline: Combine 1 part hydrogen peroxide with 1 part washing soda (or baking soda) and 2 parts water in a spray bottle.
steps.description: This will create a potent but more gentle stain remover.

steps.headline: Shake gently to combine before use.
Spray and set.
steps.description: Rub with either a clean cloth or scrub brush depending upon the fabric and stain.

steps.headline: Rinse and repeat if necessary.
steps.description: You may want to give this solution an extra rinse to ensure the baking soda is completely removed from the fabric.

steps.headline: Combine 1 part washing soda with 3 parts hydrogen peroxide in a spray bottle.
Gently shake bottle until well combined.
steps.description: Don’t overdo it as it could foam and explode.

steps.headline: Spray directly on stain and allow solution to set for several minutes.
steps.description: Use a small scrub brush to fully integrate the solution into the stain.

text: For Fresh Stains Combine 1 part hydrogen peroxide with 1 part washing soda (or baking soda) and 2 parts water in a spray bottle. This will create a potent but more gentle stain remover. Shake gently to combine before use.  Spray and set. Rub with either a clean cloth or scrub brush depending upon the fabric and stain. Rinse and repeat if necessary. You may want to give this solution an extra rinse to ensure the baking soda is completely removed from the fabric. For Stubborn Stains Combine 1 part washing soda with 3 parts hydrogen peroxide in a spray bottle.  Gently shake bottle until well combined. Don’t overdo it as it could foam and explode. Spray directly on stain and allow solution to set for several minutes. Use a small scrub brush to fully integrate the solution into the stain. Rinse and repeat if necessary.
